args: Graaagh! I'm losing control of the dragon!
Aldred's going berserk!\nWhat are we gonna do?!
This crystal was made to stimulate\nactivity in a fused body, and I must say,\nI'm rather delighted with the results!
Do not blame me, Grace—it is but another\nfruit of you and your husband's research.
Our design only stimulated activity in\na fused subject in order to help those\nwhose lives were in danger.
It was NEVER meant to force a\nperson into a rage like this!
Ah, but every tool has its use. This crystal,\nthe failed experiment...and your husband.
Would you like me to share your husband's\nTRUE last words with you, my dear?
No. That cannot be.\nThat means his killer...
Was ME! Yes, exactly! I took advantage of\nthe chaos wrought by the failure's escape\nand killed him with my own two hands!
Oh, how I loathed that man. He took\neverything I wanted and lived his life\nin blissful happiness.
But even once he was gone,\nyou STILL rejected me!
So if I cannot have you for my own,\nI will have the joy of ending you!
Oh? What now? Have you not been\npraying for death this entire time?
That's why I'm going to release the power\nstored in the memento he left me!
That's the sword with all the mana!
Grace, no! If you release that mana,\nit will destroy everything for miles!
Worry not. I'm not planning to involve\nany innocents in my own end.
Now behold the true power of the sword!
Aldred's back? What is going ON?!
This sword is a memento from my\nlate husband—one which serves to\ncontrol the magic of wyrmbinding.

Even as we worked for the Syndicate,
my husband and I advanced our own
independent research so that we might
atone for our crimes!
You think that makes you good people?\nAbsurd! The crimes you have committed\ncan NEVER be forgiven!
You mind, Grace? I mean, seeing as\nhow he's with the Syndicate and all.
I do not. It is time he atoned\nfor his sins—with his very life.
I have many things to repent for.\nMy tally is so very long.
And I am sorry to burden you\nwith even more sin.
If you're talking about that guy,\nit had nothing to do with you.
The Syndicate is my enemy,\nso I killed him. That's it.
I disagree—it DOES have to do with me.\nYour hatred begins with me and my sins.

There's plenty of sin to go around. Plus,
sounds like you and your hubby actually
tried to save us test subjects in your own
way.
That sword? Your research?\nI'd be dead without 'em.
You're surprisingly cute when you smile.
Now then, will you continue your journey\nof revenge knowing that your body\ncan be rather...unreliable?
Revenge is all I have, and my fight\nwon't end until I've ripped out the\nstill-beating heart of the Syndicate.
Even though that revenge will not return\nyour lost happiness? Even though you\nonly stand to lose even more in the end?
My past is all I have.\nI don't know another way.
We are very much alike, you and I.
I don't want to forget about him.

But if I am to go on living, I want to do so
hating everyone and everything that stole
my husband from me. I want to hold onto
that hate until the day that I die.
So please let me continue to hate you.
Let me hate you so the pain in my heart\nwill never be healed and my grief can\ncontinue unabated.
You should hate me—if I didn't escape,\nyour husband would still be alive.
And you may hate me, as well.\nHowever, I think I know a way\nto help atone for my sin.
You're talking about the power\nin that sword, aren't you?

Yes—and so I will continue my research
into it. Even if there can be no salvation
from grief, I will use my remaining life
in an attempt to atone for my sins.
Anyway, I think this is where we part.\nThank you for everything.
If you don't have a destination in mind,\nyou should strike out for the Halidom.
Yeah, there's a real bleeding heart\nof a prince there. He'll help you.
I see. Thank you, Aldred.\nLet us meet again someday.
(We are beyond redemption.\nNot even a god could save us.)
(But it is that fact—that hopelessness—\nthat gives us the path on which we\nmust continue our lives.)
